properties.name: 2i's Coffee Bar
properties.description: Posted by Musiclikedirt 59 Old Compton St, London, W1D 6HP, England59 Old Compton St, Soho, W1D 6HP Owned by professional wrestler Paul Lincoln, a musical melting pot: country, blues, jazz, skiffle, calypso and rock. "In 1958 the 2is was the fuse for the explosion that was to come in the world of UK Rock and Roll but was just a little cafe with an old battered piano in the basement. Adam Faith "a ground floor cafe, with linoleum floors and Formica tables it was downstairs, at night, that the real action took place, the record industry, fuelled by the skiffle craze, began to explode. Stars who were discovered or played there included: Cliff Richard, Hank Marvin, Tommy Steele, Carlo Little. Paul Gadd (aka Gary Glitter), Ritchie Blackmore, Alex Wharton, Mickie Most and Big Jim Sullivan. "2i\'s Wiki":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_2_I\'s_Coffee_Bar "2i\'s photos":http://www.classiccafes.co.uk/reportage1.htm "Classic cafes tour":http://www.classiccafes.co.uk/Tour_central.html

properties.name: Danny Ramplings Shoom club
properties.description: Posted by MusiclikedirtThrale Street, EnglandShoom @ The Fitness Centre (Thrale Street/Southwark Bridge Road?) Danny Rampling brought the sound of Amnesia, Ibiza to London and the gym of a Fitness Centre in Southwark that held 150 people. Legendary status for bringing house, a broad balleric sound, acid house and the smiley face to these shores. The second Summer of Love "Interview with Danny about Shoom":http://www.peom.co.uk/rampling_interview.html "History of Shoom""http://www.ministryofsound.com/Life/Clubbing/Features/Shoom.htm "Shoom ticket":http://flickr.com/photos/inertia/100375287/in/set-72057594065226098/

properties.name: Jimi Hendrix (Guitarist) / Handel (Composer) Lived here
properties.description: Posted by Musiclikedirt23 Brook Street, England"23 Brook Street":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brook_Street Jimi Hendrix and his girlfriend Kathy Etchingham moved into a flat at 23 Brook Street in central London. The adjacent building at 25 Brook Street was once the home of baroque composer George Frideric Handel. Hendrix, aware of this musical coincidence, bought Handel recordings including Messiah and the Water Music. The two houses currently comprise the Handel House Museum, where both musicians are celebrated.

properties.name: Jimi Hendrix died here (1970)
properties.description: Posted by Musiclikedirt21/22 Lansdowne Crescent, Notting Hill, EnglandSeptember 18, 1970 21/22 Lansdowne Crescent, Notting Hill Jimi Hendrix was found dead in bed in the hotel room of a German girlfriend Monika Dannemann after taking a reported nine vesperax sleeping pills and choking on his own vomit. There is some controvercy over the circumstances of his death, and whether he died at the scene. "More info at Wikkipedia":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jimi_Hendrix "Monika Dannemann":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Monika_Dannemann committed suicide after losing a libel case regarding Hendrix.

properties.name: Joe Meek  shoots himself & his landlady
properties.description: Posted by MusiclikedirtEngland304 Holloway Road, Holloway N7 Above what is now Holloway Cycles, "Joe Meek":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joe_Meek "The Telstar Man", record producer, pop impresario, and engineering genius set up Britians first ever Independent studio in 1961. On Feb 3rd 1967 after an argument Joe Meek shot his landlady Mrs Shenton dead with a shotgun before turning the gun on himself. "Joe Meek Wikipedia":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joe_Meek "BBC page and audio of Joe Meek":http://www.bbc.co.uk/music/profiles/meekjoe.shtml "Photos of the 304 Holloway Rd and other Meek sites":http://www.houseplantpicturestudio.com/HPS/joemeek/joemeek.html "Indepth story of Joe Meek":http://www.mccready.cwc.net/meek.html

properties.name: LP Cover - Soft Cell Non-Stop Erotic Cabaret
properties.description: Posted by MusiclikedirtEnglandWalkers Court, W1 At the bottom (south) end of Berwick Street past the fruit and vege stalls is the narrow lane known as "Walkers Court" formally home to Raymonds Erotic Revue. It epitomises the sleazyeness of red-light Soho, and with album track "Seedy Films" talking of long nights in porno cinemas it was perfect for Soft Cell\'s debut album ""Non-Stop Erotic Cabaret"":Back cover shot.

properties.name: LP Cover - Ziggy Stardust cover shot here
properties.description: Posted by MusiclikedirtEngland23 Heddon Street, Off Regent Street W1 The "cover of the Ziggy Stardust album":http://www.teenagewildlife.com/Albums/ZS/cover.jpg shows David Bowie posing in front of 23 Heddon Street (1972). Heddon Street is a small, quiet side-street off Regent Street. "Vist this fantastic site":http://www.5years.com/heddon.htm for loads of pictures, more background information down to exactly how to recreate the cover yourself.

properties.name: LP cover - The Jam This Is the Modern World
properties.description: Posted by MusiclikedirtEnglandThe Westway, Nr. Latimer Road, W1. The cover for The Jam\'s 1977 "LP "This Is The Modern World"":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Image:Jammodernworld.jpg was shot in the Latimer Road area of the Westway. That same year The Clash were photographed under the Westway for the rear of their debut album "The Clash".

properties.name: Mama Cass & Keith Moon died here
properties.description: Posted by MusiclikedirtEnglandFlat No.9, 12 Curzon Place, Mayfair July 1974 Mama Cass having just finished performing at the London Palladium theatre, died of a heart attack (aged 32). September 6, 1978 Keith Moon, drummer for The Who attended a party thrown by Paul McCartney. Sometime in the late afternoon of Sept 7, 1978, his girlfriend discovered him unconscious, he was rushed to the hospital, where he was later pronounced dead as a result of an overdose of a prescribed anti-alcohol drug. The flat belonged to Harry Nilsson, who distraught over the death of two friend\'s in his flat, quickly sold it to Moon\'s bandmate Pete Townshend.

properties.name: Paul & Linda McCartney marry (1969)
properties.description: Posted by MusiclikedirtEnglandMarylebone (now Westminster) Register Office 12 March 1969: Paul McCartney weds Linda Eastman. They were married for 29 years until Linda\'s death in 1998, and raised four children. "More about the wedding from the BBC.":http://news.bbc.co.uk/onthisday/hi/dates/stories/march/12/newsid_3607000/3607215.stm "View footage of the wedding":http://www.bbc.co.uk/mediaselector/check/media/video/otdvideo/69/03/12/7067_12-03-69?size=4x3&bgc=6699CC&nbram=1&nbram=1&bbram=1&news=1

properties.name: Sex Pistols born here
properties.description: Posted by MusiclikedirtEnglandOriginal guitarist "Warwick Nightingale\'s (Wally)":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wally_Nightingale council house. He formed the band with school friends Steve Jones & Paul Cook from nearby Christopher Wren School & practised here.

properties.name: Sex Pistols on the River Thames
properties.description: Posted by MusiclikedirtEnglandJune 7, 1977 As the celebrations for the Queen\'s Silver Jubilee reached their climax, the Sex Pistols\' God Save the Queen, had already caused a massive furore. On Jubilee weekend itself, two days before the royal flotilla was to process down the Thames, manager Malcolm McLaren hired a boat, and the band played a brief water-borne set in front of the Houses of Parliament, before river police called a halt. There were 11 arrests, including McLaren, but none of the band. "God Save The Queen Wikipedia":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sex_Pistols#God_Save_the_Queen

properties.name: Spandau Ballet play HMS Belfast
properties.description: Posted by MusiclikedirtEnglandHMS Belfast 26th July 1980 Spandau Ballet\'s manager on the look out for a deal with a label that wouldnt stop them from wearing their kilts, booked the HMS Belfast for a showcase gig. The former Royal Navy battle cruiser didnt know what had hit it. The crew expected a party of students and a five-piece supper band; what they got was the debauched and flamboyant cream of Londons party set. Philip Salon [transvestite club promoter] turned up in a wedding dress covered in lightbulbs. Just three months later the band were signed to Chrysalis and on Top Of The Pops performing their debut single, To Cut A Long Story Short. "Time Out feature on gig":http://www.timeout.com/london/music/features/1924.html "More about the gig":http://www.geocities.com/SunsetStrip/Palladium/7994/beginning.html "Interview with Spandau about scamming there way onto Belfast":http://www.geocities.com/bevister/int2.html

properties.name: Studio 80 - Dennis Bovell produced here
properties.description: Posted by MusiclikedirtEnglandStudio 80, 6-8 Emerson Street, SE1 Dennis Blackbeard Bovell produced many albums at this studio, including Janet Kays "Capricorn Woman", and others with Linton Kwesi Johnson, eg "Making History":http://reggae.discogs.com/release/607975 Now a marketing company

properties.name: The Africa Centre, Soul II Soul
properties.description: Posted by MusiclikedirtEnglandThe Africa Centre 38 King Street, Covent Garden WC2E A young pre-Soul II Soul Jazzie B ran the Saturday club between 1984-1986. Soul II took up a residency at African Centre before signing to Virgin Records\' subsidiary Ten Records. "Soul II Sul hisroty":http://www.soul2soul.co.uk/about/index.html "Africa Centre website":http://www.africacentre.org.uk/history.htm "Jazzie B Presents Soul II Soul At The Africa Centre CD compilation":Jazzie B Presents Soul II Soul At The Africa Centre

properties.name: The Beatles - Final live performance
properties.description: Posted by MusiclikedirtEnglandApple Headquarters located at 3 Savile Row. Last ever live performance by The Beatles on the roof of the building. As featured at the end of "Let It Be" film. Pictures of performance :http://bludream.club.fr/FRENCH/liverpool13.html

properties.name: The Clash busted for avicide
properties.description: Posted by MusiclikedirtEnglandCamden Market. Proud Galley The infamous \'Pigeon Shooting Incident\' on 30 March 1978, Paul and Topper went up on the roof of Rehearsal Rehearsals to try out an air rifle and shot and killed what they thought were three ordinary pigeons, but were in fact expensive racing birds. They were arrested and sent to Brixton Prison. Rehearsal Rehearsal is now the home of Proud Gallery Camden. Check out this amazing pictoral "London Clash website":http://myweb.tiscali.co.uk/donwhistance/theclash/LastGang.htm
